fields.description: If it was closed in the previous session and you re-open SourceTree, then no windows will open at all. I'd say always restore the bookmarks window when re-opening SourceTree, regardless of its previous state.
fields.summary: Bookmarks doesn't restore on SourceTree startup as expected

fields.description:
Ever since upgrading (yesterday) to v1.6.2.1 of Sourcetree we get the following message EVERY time we pull from our remote branches.

"Confirm Pull From Non-Tracked Branch - Are you sure you want to pull from a non-tracked branch?" - Screenshot attached

Our remote repository is a Stash repository. We have around 70 repos and until yesterday had NEVER seen this message before. I've double and triple checked and made sure all local branches are tracking the remote branch correctly.

To replicate I just right click on the name of my local branch in the left and choose "Pull origin/develop (tracked)".

As you can imagine the popup message is becoming quite annoying. I don't want to tick the "Don't ask again" checkbox because I DO want to be notified when I'm pulling from a non-tracked branch 

Hope you guys can help out here.

Thanks
fields.summary: Confirm Pull From Non-Tracked Branch unexpected

fields.description:
When pulling from a remote Git clone (e.g. {{origin/master}}), SourceTree warns me that I am about to pull from an untracked branch, even though ST indicates in several other places that I am actually tracking the remote branch, for example in the context menu for the local branch:
* one of the options is "Pull origin/master (tracked)"
* if I choose "Track Remote Branch", the "origin/master" option is already ticked.

I'd try to replicate this and provide a screenshot, but I inadvertently chose "Don't warn me about this again" and can't find where to turn this flag off (it's not in the Preferences dialog, for example).
fields.summary: Warning about pulling from untracked branch when branch is actually being tracked

fields.description:
While in the commit dialog and especially when entering a message, the updater shouldn't appear. This occurred while I was in the middle of typing a commit message and before I realised what was happening I'd already hit enter or space on the message I'd typed selecting one of the options.

When I'm in the commit dialog, it'd be useful not to prompt for updates due to the high possibility of being in the middle of typing up a commit message.
fields.summary: Accidental input when updater prompts in commit dialog

fields.description:
I would appeciate it if you could implement a search to filter the branch list on the left side.

If you have a lot branches in one repository it takes some time to find the right one. A search would be a big time saver.
fields.summary: Search for branch name

fields.description:
(Standalone?) SourceTree App for Mac

O/S: Mac OSX v10.8.3

Key bindings for particular actions such as staging & discarding particular lines of text for commits would be a huge time saver for me. Customization of said bindings would be a nice, but non-essential bonus.

Many, many thanks for the great work you guys have done on this software, I absolutely do not want to ever live a day without it since discovering :-D
fields.summary: Key Bindings

fields.description: Crashes when you context-click on a file in column view in Mercurial
fields.summary: Crash when context-clicking on a file in Mercurial in column view

fields.description: AAC here: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/185210/why-does-sourcetree-connect-to-a-remote-repository-when-i-commit-locally
fields.summary: Connects to remotes when pref turned off

fields.description: If you right-click a folder in the files tree, it crashes. Reproduced with multiple repos across different machines.
fields.summary: Right-clicking folder in "Files in the working tree" crashes

fields.description:
We have folders to group our branches (feature/, bug/ etc.).  Some developers have used Feature/branch_name_1 and others have used feature/branch_name_2 (the difference being the capital F on the folder).

SourceTree will only show one of those folders (so in my origin/ I can only see Feature/branches and not feature/branches).

On the command line if I git fetch or pull, the branches from the other feature folder are created (and git branch --all lists them).

If I just to SourceTree they are listed (all under the same Feature folder) but when I fetch, the ones that use lowercase f are removed and even git branch --all doesn't show them).

We are unable to rename the branches (SourceTree - or could it be git - is insisting on using the previous case for Features everywhere) so we're stuck in a position where we cannot see half of our branches in SourceTree.

** Also occurs in Windows **
fields.summary: Folders with same names but different cases do not display correctly

fields.description:
https://support.atlassian.com/browse/STSP-616

Not been able to reproduce this yet, however when the user removes the .gitmodules file SourceTree will work fine. This needs dev attention rather than support so escalated to here.

Blocker so highest priority.
fields.summary: Faulty gitmodules file crashes SourceTree

fields.description: This report has come from SAC (https://support.atlassian.com/browse/STSP-585) but it was originally reported via AAC (https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/104657/source-tree-often-fails-to-commit) with many people reporting the problem. We still never got to the bottom of it as there's no reason it should be happening based on what we know. Escalating it to JAC regardless and hope to provide a consistent reproduction so we can get to the bottom of it.
fields.summary: "error: unable to create temporary file: File exists"

fields.description:
Open GitHub/BitBucket repo in Browser from the Repository menu.

I know there is an option for this in the Hoste repository view but it would be better if we could access this option from the Repository menu also.
fields.summary: Open GitHub/BitBucket repo in Browser from the Repository menu

fields.description: I use "git log master..<mybranch>" a lot to see only commits of this branch. It would be incredibly useful to have that option as well (analogue to the Mercurial branch view).
fields.summary: Git branch view: List only commits of this branch

fields.description:
# Launch SourceTree.app
# Open repo window.
# Ctrl+Click on toolbar.
# Select "Customize Toolbar..." from menu.
# *"Show in Finder" icon shows low resolution* 


* 64x64 size icon is required. 
** e.g. SourceTree.app/Contents/Resources/Terminal_32x32.tiff contains both size image 32x32 and 64x64.
** SourceTree.app/Contents/Resources/finder.png  has 32x32 size image *ONLY*.
fields.summary: "Show in Finder" icon in toolbar shows low resolution in retina display Macs.

fields.description:
A tag was added to the last commit on the develop branch before the merge to the master branch.  I tried to move the tag to the master commit.  It was successful on the local git repo but then failed when moving on the remote repo at Bitbucket.

In the Add Tag window, I selected the 0.60 tag from the popup menu, selected the 'Specified commit' button and picked the merge commit on the master branch (f8fba4).  Enabled the Push tag checkbox, expanded the Advanced Options and enabled the Move Existing Tag checkbox.  Clicked Add and got the following in the log window.

{noformat}git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false tag -a -m  -f 0.60 f8fba4f2e5f537d1d7d4b210c853bb587cdc67d6 
Updated tag '0.60' (was 2d7d6bd)

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false push -v Bitbucket refs/tags/0.60 
Pushing to git@bitbucket.org:InsomniacSoftware/acdc.git
To git@bitbucket.org:InsomniacSoftware/acdc.git
 ! [rejected]        0.60 -> 0.60 (already exists)
error: failed to push some refs to 'git@bitbucket.org:InsomniacSoftware/acdc.git'
hint: Updates were rejected because the tag already exists in the remote.
Completed with errors, see above{noformat}

Note that the Updated tag line says (was 2d7d6bd) however, I don't have a commit with that hash in the entire repo history.  Do tags have their own tracking hashes?

I was able to resolve this issue by removing the 0.60 tag from the local and remote repos then add the tag again onto the proper commit.
fields.summary: Fails to move remote tag

fields.description:
It would be great to update to Mercurial 2.6.2 (mainly because of histedit support). When I download Mercurial from its official homepage and try to set  the System Mercurial manually, it says:

SourceTree requires a few small changes to Mercurial to run optimally, but applying one of these patches (hg_patch_prompting_hg1.9.diff) against your system copy failed with the error ''

SourceTree will use its internal copy of Mercurial instead.
fields.summary: Update embedded Mercurial version 2.2.2 / manual patching fails

fields.description:
When doing a pull if you specify the branch the fetch doesn't specify that particular branch.

Reported via AAC: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/183969/pull-a-certain-branch-only
fields.summary: Pull doesn't honour branch settings

fields.description: After a while the list of local branches can get long, and since only a few branches are used regularly it would be nice to be able to hide or archive those that are not currently used but might be useful to use again later on.
fields.summary: As a user I want to be able to hide or archive local branches that are no longer used

fields.description:
It seems to me that if I have a merge conflict and I select "Resolve Using Theirs..." source tree actually resolves using my changes, and if I select "Resolve Using Mine..." source tree actual resolves using theirs!

See: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/180870/merge-conflicts-resolve-using-theirs-vs-mine
fields.summary: Merge conflicts resolve using mine rather than theirs (and vice-versa)

fields.description:
I'm trying to rename a file from tradinghistory/settlementReports/2013/20130327 Report_Statement (1).csv to tradinghistory/settlementReports/2013/20130327 Report_Statement.csv. When I do this via the move command, it moves it to tradinghistory/history/settlementReports/2013/20130327 Report_Statement.csv - i.e. it adds an extraneous "history" directory in the target. If I rename source files from within IntelliJ, this works, but the same issue happens within SourceTree. Thanks

See question: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/182823/renaming-a-file-doesn-t-work

I've also attached files which show the issue (on a different file).
fields.summary: Issues when renaming files

fields.description: While the https://id.atlassian.com and https://bitbucket.org/ sites allow to log in using an email address, SourceTree only allows a username to be used to log in to Bitbucket. Would be nice to have the choice to login with an email address as well.
fields.summary: Bitbucket Log In Not Consistent With Bitbucket Website

fields.description:
It seems like this is the case even when the preference "Check default remotes for updates every XX minutes" is un-ticked. I think this affect me more than most as I deal with a bunch of clones of a single, huge git repository. The .git directory is 29GB in size and the checkout size is 7GB. 

This is now more annoying than it used to be as https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREE-1612 means that the bookmarks view is always opened for me when SourceTree is opened and the up-to-date checks seem to get kicked off immediately in the background.

Thanks,

Jools

p.s. What Git commands are you running to work out how far ahead / behind you are?
fields.summary: Bookmarks Window always checks remotes for updates

fields.description: If you create a new shelve named the same as a prior shelve users may expect it to be amended, but in reality it will be overwritten. Git offers no warning of this so we should do so through SourceTree instead. This won't affect the implementation details, just check if there's a shelve with that name.
fields.summary: Warn if overwriting a shelve

fields.description:
v1.6.1 of SourceTree shows annoying reminder telling me to Update to OSX 10.7.5 because of Keychain Access issues. It shows me this EVERY SINGLE TIME I start up SourceTree.
I am glad you are concerned about my Keychain access but I do not need to be reminded everytime.
You need to provide an option to turn this off.
I have not plans to upgrade to 10.7.5 or 10.8.2 anytime soon.

The warning started popping up on the version previous to 1.6.1 (so 1.6 maybe?) and has continued since upgrading to 1.6.1.
I am using https for all repositories (all on bitbucket.org) and I have personally not had any issues with keychain access with this version or any previous versions of SourceTree. I have been using SourceTree for about a year now, and started with OS X 10.7.1 and am now on OS X 10.7.4.
fields.summary: Annoying reminder to upgrade OSX shows everytime I start SourceTree

fields.description:
Commits got out of order, branches got inconsistent.
There is workaround to set the ancestor order, take a look:
http://cl.ly/image/0R0s2W3N331u — ancestor order (represents right state)
http://cl.ly/image/1B0n2Z2d3h1o — date order.
As you can see, in the date order  commits "Fixed..." and "Added..." are swapped and purple line seems to have no end (http://cl.ly/image/101s3p2L0M43 — screenshot at the beginning of repo history).
Actually, "Fixed.." is a parent for "Added.." commit. These commits has equal "Commit Date" field, but different "Date" field.

I'm using git version 1.7.12.4 (Apple Git-37)

Maybe this is related: SRCTREE-966
fields.summary: Out of order commits

fields.description:
When deleting a local branch, there is currently no indication of whether it is 'safe' to delete the branch; you only find out after clicking delete when force is not ticked (because the git command fails).

It would be nice to know in the delete prompt if the branch to delete is merged or not, and show/hide the force option appropriately.

On the command line, the merged status of a branch can effectively be found by running {{git branch --all --contains [commit hash at head of branch]}}. If only the branch to be deleted is listed, the deletion is lossy; if additional branches are listed, then the deletion is safe. From a quick test, this appears to be the same way git determines if the force delete option is required to delete a branch.
fields.summary: Include merge status in branch deletion dialog

fields.description:
It seems that if automatic refresh of a repo remotes is enabled, that all submodules are refreshed as well. When working with a lot of submodules, this severely hampers performance.

This delay is most noticable when switching back to SourceTree after (the default) 10 minutes when an auto refresh is happening. The entire UI unresponsive for ~10 seconds. Having this be optional would greatly improve usability.

I'm working with about 20 submodules, all hosted remotely.
fields.summary: Submodule fetches should be optional

fields.description: If you don't create a commit when you create a hotfix and try to finish the hotfix then no error is signified from the git flow call. Need to create a pull request on git flow so it throws an error rather than return success.
fields.summary: Git Flow doesn't throw error when no commits made between creating and finishing hotfix

fields.description: Spoke to Joel regarding this. Simplify it a bit and get rid of the refresh button in the top right corner. Move "Edit Accounts" next to "Create Repository" as these are related. Then you can right align the search bar instead
fields.summary: Get rid of refresh button and right-align top button/search in hosted repositories

fields.description:
When I select lines non-contiguous and click stage selected lines a message will pop up, that this is not supported.

If it's a technical matter it can be done doing multiple steps for each contiguous line selection.
fields.summary: Allow staging non-contiguous line selection

fields.description: SourceTree does not work with Mac OS X Mavericks. At startup the program hangs and does not start.
fields.summary: SourceTree Not Working with Mac OS X 10.9 (Mavericks)

fields.description:
Select several commits and try to copy'n'paste them to an editor: nothing to copy.

User would like to be able to transfer selected text from the log view to some other application -- at least a textual version.
fields.summary: Ability to copy the list of selected commits in the log view to the clipboard

fields.description:
When finishing a feature in SourceTree using Git-Flow actions, choosing the option to keep a feature branch is not respect if the OS is in French (or perhaps in another language as well).

Steps to reproduce (with a French OS: {{System Preferences > International}}):
# {{Git-Flow > Start New Feature}}: "foo"
# Switch to new branch "feature/foo"
# Commit on the feature.
# [{{Git-Flow > Finish Feature}}: "foo"|^screenshot1.png]
# [Select "Gardez la branche" and "OK"|^screenshot2.png]
# Branch has been deleted.

In English, [it keeps the branch|^screenshot3.png].
fields.summary: Git-Flow Does Not Keep Branch When Finishing Feature If OS Language Is French

fields.description: I can change visible date from committer date to author date, but "Date order" still sorts by committer date. If that's normal behavior, then it would be great to add SUBJ as option.
fields.summary: Sort commits by author date

fields.description:
SourceTree has an embedded Mercurial that is about a year old. I tried to have it use my system Mercurial, which is version 2.6, and it showed an error message: "Patching Mercurial failed", "SourceTree requires a few small changes to Mercurial to run optimally, but applying one of these patches (hg_patch_prompting_hg1.9.diff) against your system copy failed with the error ''
SourceTree will use its internal copy of Mercurial instead."
fields.summary: System mercurial cannot be used

fields.description: I use submodules, and share this submodule with multiple projects. If I'm working on two of the project, i'll often have the submodule open on both sites, but the name is just the last component of the submodule name, which will always be the same, hence, I can't differentiate them easily. Would be nice if you just added the full path or some additional path components to make the names unique.
fields.summary: Expand name in title bar to be unique

fields.description:
Just today there was scheduled downtime at Apache's Git infrastructure. 

During this period, https://git-wip-us.apache.org/ didn't respond in a timely fashion. Only after around 5 minutes did it return an HTTP 503.

This circumstance hung SourceTree when trying to clone a repo, and I had to Force Quit it.
fields.summary: Cloning an unresponsive Git repository hangs SourceTree

fields.description:
Social convention for Git commits at some organizations is like an email body and message, as seen at http://tbaggery.com/2008/04/19/a-note-about-git-commit-messages.html. For some, this is enforced technically by limiting the first line of the commit to 50 characters and wrapping the rest at 72.

I propose either automating this behavior in SourceTree or providing us with the visual guidelines to do it ourselves. It's really the only thing keeping me from using SourceTree over GitX.

EDIT: I apologize for my stupidity, I just realized we already have fixed-width commits and wrapping. However, my request for limiting the first line in some manner still stands. :)
fields.summary: Column character count when fixed-width pref set for commit message input

fields.description:
Currently the bookmark list only shows branches the repositories are checked out at.

It'd be useful if they displayed a tag name if a tag was checked out - it just says *(no branch)* at the moment. Which in fact is true, but not useful.
fields.summary: Bookmarks window should display Tag name if checked out from one

fields.description:
The purpose is to allow to edit the message that is self generated when closing a branch. This could be done by both editing at commit-time than defining a template for such a message.

This feature is useful in the environment in which the validity of the messages is checked by external script.
fields.summary: Add the possibility to edit close-branch message.

fields.description:
Project windows restored upon startup always appear with the left sidebar taking up a majority of the widow's width, with the remaining panes squeezed  on the right.

Oddly , if multiple windows get restored, only one exhibits this behavior (i.e. one window restored has a strange split, but if three windows get restored, only one of them is affected).  So far, I haven't been able to determine what determines which window gets affected in such group.
fields.summary: Strange project window pane split upon startup

fields.description:
Hi,

I'd like to be able to search through commits with more facilities:
- wildcards
- regular expressions
- multiple words
- full words or not
- case sensitive or not

As it is, refining to find a specific commit is very tedious. You basically have to go through almost all history.

Regards and as always, thanks for SourceTree, best front-end for Git/HG ever :)
fields.summary: Better search through commits

fields.description: When initializing Hg Flow on the command line it creates files named .hgflow in each branch. SourceTree will only recognize files named .flow. HgFlow recognizes either filename, but only creates .hgflow. SourceTree should also recognize both file names.
fields.summary: Recognize existing hgflow configuration file

fields.description:
I have some branches on local, and about eight on two remotes: origin (our shared server) and my home computer. For now I only can choose to show one branch, local branches or all. 
Can you please implement multiple branches selection, so I can choose which branches I need now? It will be good to have some checkboxes in the left sidebar. 

(it seems very strange that in JIRA version 1.6.1 is marked as unreleased, but I've just downloaded this version from the website...)
fields.summary: Show several branches

fields.description: Maybe this is because I'm a relatively recent n00b, but I often get caught in rebase mode and not knowing that to resume I have to find Actions > Continue to complete. Given that this is really the only action to run when in rebase mode, could this be more visible or obvious? I've noticed that the footer shows when you are in "rebase" mode, but there are no actions that you can run from there.
fields.summary: When in "rebase" mode, give me a big button to finish the rebase

fields.description: We now honour the system preferences from Mac OS X 10.7+ and so should get rid of the SourceTree preference for users using 10.7+. It still needs to exist for 10.6 users, however, as that system preference does not exist.
fields.summary: Get rid of "Re-open project windows at startup" pref from 10.7+

fields.description:
Hi,

I'd like to be able to search through diff view.
Might be a good idea to be able to restrict search to modified lines only.

Cheers,
Hubert
fields.summary: Search in diff view

fields.description: The push count on the push toolbar icon is not updated as fast as the push count on branches, leading to [an incoherent push count|^screenshot1.png].
fields.summary: Incoherent Push Count

fields.description:
When initializing Hg Flow with the "Hg Flow" button I enter the values:

* *Production branch* - production
* *Development branch* - default
* *Feature branch prefix* - feature/
* *Release branch prefix* - release/
* *Hotfix branch prefix* - hotfix/
* *Version tag prefix* - empty (because you can't enter anything)

After clicking ok SourceTree makes a .flow file that looks like:
{code}
[branchname]
master = default
develop = develop
feature = feature/
release = release/
hotfix = hotfix/
{code}

These values are incorrect. The master should be "production" and develop should be "default".
fields.summary: Hg Flow init ignores branch names for production and development

fields.description: It would be nice to have a way to define the tab size while in "Diff View". As it is, indentation [doesn't match|^screenshot1.png] other settings (eg. [IDE|^screenshot2.png])
fields.summary: Define Tab Size in Diff View

fields.description:
The list of bookmarked repositories is displayed each time source tree is launched.

It'd be nice for source-tree to remember last opened repository.
fields.summary: Remember last opened repository

fields.description: From STSP: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/STSP-570
fields.summary: SourceTree doesn't show commits when the author's name is in unicode

fields.description:
This seems to be happening when changes are pushed on the remote repo from an other clone and then the ST repo is detecting those changes

How to reproduce:

Set the filter to "Hide Remote Branches" in ST for the repo.

Close the ST GUI for the repo , or close ST.

Push on the remote repo some changes from an other clone that the one used by ST. 

Wait for a longer time than the time defined in the "check default remotes for updates every M minutes."

Open again the GUI for the repo. The filter is reset to "Show Remote Branches".
fields.summary: "Hide Remote Branches filter setting is not remembered

fields.description: It would be useful in the "Working Copy Changes" section to have the latest Modification Date of the files listed.
fields.summary: Latest Modification Date of the files listed
Graph view date oder does not use the output from git log --date-order

fields.description:
Reproduce:

* Select two commits not on current branch (one of which is head of another branch).
* right click on one of them and choose cherry pick
* follow process to make new commit

Observed result:

* SourceTree fails during git command, complaining that a cherry-pick is already in progress.

Expected result:

* both commits get recreated (either together or separately) as commits against the current branch.

If the commits are separately cherry-picked there is no problem (and no merge conflicts) although the combined request fails, even though one is allowed to pick several commits and ask to cherry pick them all.
fields.summary: Can't cherry pick several commits at once

fields.description:
Provide a Mercurial preference which allows to hide inactive branches. You can do this by passing the "-a" flag to the branches call. The docs state it (hg help branches):

If -a/--active is specified, only show active branches. A branch is
    considered active if it contains repository heads.
fields.summary: Hide inactive branches

fields.description:
I'm using the Hg flow feature to manage my feature branches as I find it really convenient. Unfortunatly I regularly experience the same kind of issue when working in a rush:
I first start a new feature, thus creating a new branch. Working on this branch, I'll commit my changes several times until the new feature is fully implemented and tested. Once my work is done, I'll finish the feature. SourceTree will then close the feature branch for me and merge it with the develop branch.
The problem is that if I still have some local changes at that stage, they will be committed along with the other changes during the merge phase. Those local changes are usually local configuration.

Expected behavior:
When finishing a feature, only the committed changes are merged to develop, not my uncommitted local changes.
I know this issue might be linked to the behavior of Mercurial itself. That would mean that my local repository is clean before I can finish a feature. In that case, I'd like to be prompted that I have local changes before the branch is closed and the merge is performed so that I can cancel the operation and revert my local changes or shelve them. This will still be a better solution than having unwanted changes on the develop branch.
fields.summary: SourceTree commits local changes when closing a feature

fields.description: Add support for managing the personal repos stash now provides.
fields.summary: Support for personal repos in stash

fields.description:
version:SourceTree 1.6.0.1
os: ML 10.8.3
computer: mackbook pro whit retina 15

Please look at the attachment picture, it's clearly show the problem.
fields.summary: SourceTree display problem on macbook retina

fields.description:
As you can see from the attached screen shot, the upgrade prompt says:

{quote}A new version of  is ready to install{quote}

The product name seems to be missing.

I was auto-upgrading from 1.6.0.1.
fields.summary: Upgrade prompt dialog has missing product name

fields.description:
Preference option "Re-open project windows at startup" is ticked but windows/projects open when I close (cmd-Q) SourceTree are not re-opened on next startup. Observed in 1.6.0.1 (is this b1?).

Reproduce:
- Open SourceTree (from the Dock)
- Open a repository/project window from bookmarks window
- CMD-Q to quit SourceTree
- Re-invoke SourceTree (from the Dock)

Observed behaviour:
- Only the bookmark window is opened. No other windows/projects are open.

Expected behaviour:
- All the projects open when quitting should re-open (in the same place) when restarting SourceTree.

The behaviour was correct in versions prior to 1.6.0 (I don't know about 1.6.0 itself).
fields.summary: Option "Re-open project windows at startup" doesn't.

fields.description:
The fetch shortcut used to be shift+cmd+F but the fullscreen has taken over it (it got auto-disabled when we created the fullscreen shortcut). Create a fetch shortcut which is instead alt+cmd+F. We can't use shift+cmd+F because fullscreen adheres to Apple UI standards.

Reported via AAC here: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/172296/why-did-you-guys-remove-the-command-shift-f-shortcut-to-fetch
fields.summary: Fetch shortcut no longer honoured because of full-screen shortcut

fields.description:
When using SourceTree, I'm a big fan of seeing the commands that are being sent off to git/hg and the responses.  Right now, SourceTree presents the "Show Full Output" control when running a command, with the option in the prefs to "Always display full console output".   But there's two problems with this approach.  First, if the"always display" option isn't checked, then the "Show full output" control is almost useless - the popup window disappears as soon as the command is completed, and it's a race of one's mouse to click that button before the whole window disappears.  If the "always display" option is checked, then I get a modal dialogue window stuck open on every operation, even when I run an external command to open my editor, which is really annoying.

What would be nicest would be a new window that is just a traditional "running console" of operations, which could be affixed as a pane within the window, such as on the lower left.   Then one could scroll through this to see everything that was happening as needed without the need to click open any windows or close any modal dialogues.
fields.summary: Add a dedicated "console" view

fields.description:
When reading the log in the log view, provide a way to generate a text version summarising the selected commits.  This would either be in the clipboard or produced in some viewable form that allows copying into a text document or editor.

The textual list form would include the commit (short) name, the branch it was on, and the description.

This would be very useful for generating summaries or reports of changes for release notes or development process analyses.

This could also be provided for other selectable views, for example a log extract based upon a file.
fields.summary: Generate a list from a log extract

fields.description:
When in the middle of an interactive rebase, the commit dialog forces the 'amend' checkbox to be checked.

For example, from the command line do:

{code}
$ git rebase -i foo
{code}

Make one of the commands "edit"

{code}
edit 897bc96 Blah blah.
pick 66576eb Blah blah blah.

# Rebase 2a3aac5..66576eb onto 2a3aac5
#...
{code}

Make some changes and stage them.  Click the "Commit" button in SourceTree.  The dialog has the amend checkbox checked, and the checkbox is greyed out so you cannot alter the setting.

!amend.png!

However, this is not a git requirement.  From the git command line I can happily make new commits (and not just amend the last one).  I would like to be able to do the same thing from SourceTree.
fields.summary: When in the middle of an interactive rebase, the commit dialog forces the 'amend' checkbox to be checked.

fields.description:
nvie's gitflow plugin supports "-S" option for feature finish command.
It makes squashing feature during merged to Develop branch.

It would be helpful, linking a ticket to manage entire code change for the feature and some code review process.
fields.summary: Support "-S" option for feature finish command

fields.description: It would be really interesting if we have the software GUI in other languages than English.
fields.summary: Translate GUI for multiple languages.

fields.description:
Originally raised here: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/169987/how-to-make-sourcetree-prompt-for-conflict-files-in-a-merge

The problem appears to be merging branch A into branch B, where files have been removed in branch A but still exist in branch B and have been modified in branch B since B branched from A (in the example, branch A was 'develop' and branch B was a feature branch). A conflict for these files was expected and happened on the command line but not in SourceTree.

It may be related to the fact that SourceTree uses a merge helper tool (merge-tools.sourcetreebulkmerge), this is to prevent hg from prompting to resolve conflicts for every file as the 'hg merge' runs, and instead to create the 'chevron' files which can be resolved later at the user's discretion. Perhaps this is not dealing correctly with this specific case.
fields.summary: Hg merge behaves differently than default command line with removed files

fields.description: Rebase interactive now supports an autosquash mode which basically takes commit messages and uses them to derive what should be automatically done in an interactive rebase. For example, if the commit message was "fixup! Some commit" it would generate a rebase file with this line below "Some commit" line.
fields.summary: Support autosquash in GRI

fields.description:
Based on a discussion on Twitter. Basically need to be able to drag/drop rows and it cause a fixup rather than a squash. We're thinking of just having a 'mode' where you switch between fixup and squash via a drop-down. This means when dragging/dropping rows it'll do one or the other dependent on what's selected. We're assuming users will only want one of the two anyway.

https://twitter.com/raulvk/status/334685836392144896
fields.summary: Support 'fixup' in GRI

fields.description: This issue is to address all French translation problems. Please keep this open as it'll be a continuous process.
fields.summary: French translations (keep open)

fields.description:
User has the option "Allow SourceTree to modify your global Mercurial and Git configuration files" turned ON and he cannot modify his diff/merge tools in SourceTree. No reproduction available yet until we get further information.

Related thread on AAC here: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/92976/external-diff-command-won-t-launch-araxis-merge

Blocker as can't perform necessary function in ST.
fields.summary: User cannot set merge/diff tool when general update config pref is turned on

fields.description:
Two reports via Twitter.

https://twitter.com/KendallTotten/status/332270209404657664
https://twitter.com/_markfinger/status/334255866859622400
fields.summary: Sparkle error on update for 1.6

fields.description: If you switch branches when there's no outstanding changes then the prompt appears offering the option to discard local changes. This shouldn't be present if there is nothing to discard.
fields.summary: Switching branches with no changes prompts to discard changes

fields.description: I just got the update to 1.6.0.1 and the 're-open project windows at startup' preference doesn't work anymore. I have it checked and it would open the bookmarks window and my one project window when starting. Now it just opens the bookmarks window. I've tried unchecking, exiting and rechecking the option in case the preference database was confused but it didn't help.
fields.summary: Project reopen not working

fields.description:
I wonder if there's anything that can be done to improve performance on refreshes.  
It's frustrating to be going through my diffs in sourcetree finding minor text changes to make, because every time I make an edit and come back to source tree, there's a substantial lag for it to catch up.

I'm seeing 9 seconds to refresh after deleting a newline.  Refresh time seems pretty consistent, not variable.

(Does it refresh the whole project, or just the changed file?  It may be relevant that my project is large.)
fields.summary: Refresh performance
Include filter/find shortcuts (⌘F and/or ⇧⌘F)

fields.description:
User is getting a strange error. I've redacted the specific information below since this issue is public, but I've provided a link to the support ticket privately.

{noformat}
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false clone --recursive
https://USER@bitbucket.org/USER/REPO.git /Users/USER/path
fatal: I don't handle protocol
'/private/var/folders/pm/pmsPvq+QGsu+EVgIkACrhU+++TI/Tmp/https'
{noformat}
fields.summary: Strange cache file showing up as a protocol

fields.description:
Now that 1.6 has been released, there is a neat drop-down that allows us to show any branch (+ the current one) rather than all branches. However, when selecting a branch on the left, the filter always goes to All Branches, and selecting the current branch won't return it to "Current Branch". The drop-down isn't the easiest to use, either, as if there are a lot of branches checked out, it will be cut off near the top of the screen and necessitate scrolling. Going back and forth from "All Branches" yields a lot of moving around the tree that isn't necessary.

My suggestion is that selecting a branch should force the filter to "selected branch + current branch". Selecting the current branch would bring it back to "current branch only". The user would need to select "All branches" explicitly to invoke it.

It should also be the case that "All Branches" and "Current branch" are always near the top of the list rather than scrolled down regardless of the currently selected branch filter.
fields.summary: Selecting a branch always forces the filter to "All Branches"

fields.description:
h3.Steps to reproduce
# Create a submodule in SourceTree with '.' in the path eg:
{noformat}
[submodule "test.submodule"]
        path = test.submodule
        url = http://kahloun.foong@localhost:7990/scm/tst/stash.git
{noformat}
# Right click on the submodule name in SourceTree and select 'delete'
# An error will occur (refer to screenshot) and the {{.gitmodule}} file is corrupted:
{noformat}
        path = test.submodule
        url = http://kahloun.foong@localhost:7990/scm/tst/stash.git
[submodule "tes"]
submodule}.url=(null)
submodule}.path=(null)
{noformat}

This happen to SourceTree for Windows 0.9.2.2 too
fields.summary: Deleting submodule with '.' in the path breaks .gitmodules

fields.description:
In order to skip the extra step of adding or staging files, I often use Commit Selected. However, this option is not allowed when the only selected item is a reference to a submodule commit.
To reproduce:
1. Add a submodule within the outer repository.
2. Open the submodule, change a file, and commit the change.
3. In the outer project, select the submodule's "file". The Commit Selected button and menu entry are disabled.
fields.summary: "Commit Selected" is disabled for submodule references

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce the bug:
1) Tap on Branch button
A popup will be shown with "New Branch" and "Delete Branches" buttons
2) Select "Delete Branches"
3) Resize the popup
Expected: When popup is resized the content should be resized too.
Actual: When popup is resized, the content stay unresized.
fields.summary: Delete branches screen can be resized, but the content in the screen stay unresized (see screenshot)

fields.description:
I have an hg branch which name contains ':'.
In the Log View, when switching to the "Current Branch", I encounter an error: 'hg log' failed with code 255:'abort: unknown revision <branch name>'

As far as I know, branches with ':' are properly handled in command-line Mercurial
fields.summary: Diff on a branch with ':' in its name

fields.description: I often have SourceTree windows open on more than one desktop.  It would be nice to have some way to quickly access the Bookmarks window when it is already open on a different desktop.  For example when the menu item is selected or the accelerator key is pressed then a new instance of the Bookmarks window could be opened on the current desktop if there isn't one already.  Or alternatively, the Bookmarks window could be moved to the current desktop if it is open and not already on the current desktop.
fields.summary: Bookmarks window accessibility

fields.description:
When I'm committing code via the git command line, I get something like this:

{noformat}
# Please enter the commit message for your changes. Lines starting
# with '#' will be ignored, and an empty message aborts the commit.
# On branch issue/39
{noformat}

When I commit code via SourceTree, the branch is not displayed in the commit panel. And yes, I've committed to the wrong branch several times because of that.

I suggest adding the branch name to the top of this panel. Alternately, it could go to the left of the Recent messages popup.
fields.summary: Show branch on commit panel

fields.description:
The shortcut for "fullscreen" is Cmd Shift F which previously was shortcut for "fetch"

Please use the default shortcut for "fullscreen" in OSX Cmd Ctrl F in SourceTree and Cmd Shift F for "fetch"
fields.summary: Incorrect fullscreen shortcut

fields.description:
When using some huge codebases, sometimes I have to select a lot of files in work tree, which causes the diff view freezes for quite long time. 

So I'd like to suggest SourceTree have an option to disable show diffs.

A better alternative is to set a maximum diff view limit, if the selected files exceeded the limit, the diffs are not shown. Because obviously user's intention is not to see the diffs.

I have the same request to SourceTree for Windows as well. Do I have to log a separate bug to SourceTreeWin project?

Thanks!

-Jonny
fields.summary: Wish to have an option to disable diff view

fields.description: When I install Mercurial 2.6 from mercurial.selenic.com, SourceTree reports that it cannot patch it for use as system Mercurial (instead of embedded hg 2.2.2). The patch worked up to Mercurial 2.5.4
fields.summary: SourceTree Patch for System Mercurial 2.6 Binary fails

fields.description:
When cloning a git repo confusion can arise due to interaction between the destination path and bookmark name fields.

When I add a git url and then select a destination path, the folder selected for destination is used as the bookmark name. This is contrary to native git behaviour where git clones the repo into a folder within the destination.

eg: cloning git@github.com:foo/foobar.git into /users/john/projects results in a local /users/my/projects/foobar

With the current SourceTree behaviour I need to manually append the bookmark name to the destination path. If I don't do this then what happens is: 'git@github.com:foo/foobar.git' is cloned as the name 'projects' in '/users/john' destination.

This behaviour has caught me out a few times. I've also seen a number of git novices using SourceTree have major confusion about where their projects have been cloned to.

It would be helpful if the application did the following:

1. Default the bookmark name to the git repo name (e.g. foobar)
2. Append the bookmark name to the destination path.

Appending to the destination path might be problematic since we have to modify the path after each selection (and avoid duplicating the appended value). For a potential approach have a look at GitExtensions (Windows). They have the destination path field contain the parent folder. Then directly below they have a read-only field that displays the destination path with the bookmark name appended with some copy saying this is where the repo will be cloned to. Its a little ugly but its very clear what is going to happen - I can change the destination or the name and the impact is alway reflected back to me. 

I hope you are able to address this issue. Its the one difficulty I have with an otherwise excellent application.
fields.summary: Bookmarks - Clone repository workflow can be confusing

fields.description:
SourceTree does not maintain its full-screen window setting between launches.

STR:

1. Launch SourceTree.
2. View -> Enter Full Screen.
3. Quit SourceTree.
4. Relaunch SourceTree.

Expected: SourceTree restores itself to full screen showing the previously-active working copy, as was displayed at quit.

Actual: the Bookmarks window opens in the current space.  No working copy is opened.  (Even when one is then chosen from the bookmarks, it opens in a window only, and not full screen.)

When I relaunch SourceTree, I want it to bring me back to where I left off.  Current behaviour requires three extra steps (open the bookmark, make it full screen, go and close the bookmarks window).

This is a follow-up to SRCTREE-1030 (reported by another user under 10.7) which was apparently closed without resolution.
fields.summary: Does not remember full screen mode

fields.description:
Because I use this for some graphics projects which have large binary files I have set up my own gitolite server.  So far everything seems to work if you know what project you need.  I do not see how to add my server as a sever (like you would add a bitbucket account) so you can browse projects not on the local machine.  I right now have people running
ssh [server name] info 
which will tell them all the projects their user has access then typing in the project they want into SourceTree.  It would be cool if I could let them browse them from within SourceTree.
fields.summary: Support for Gitolite

fields.description: I Hope to provide Chinese language support，I can provide free translation services, many people in China in the SRCTREE tools.We feel good,But even better Chinese, Japanese and other Central Asian language support.
fields.summary: Hope to provide Chinese language support (简体中文#zh_CN)

fields.description: It would be nice to manage hook scripts both for individual repositories and globally (through the git-template in git-core folder) through the user interface.
fields.summary: Manage hooks for repositories and globally through SourceTree
Untranslated strings

fields.description: Clicking on it does initiate an interactive rebase too, but just generates errors.
fields.summary: "Interactive rebase" context menu item available on uncommitted changes log row

fields.description:
This is either a (urgent!) feature request or a request for help finding a feature.
Is there a way to disable the popup notifications (at the top right of the GUI) that come up telling me there are changes to pull? I see these now that I've upgraded to 1.6.0, and I can't find a preference to disable them.
These are very distracting. They appear to be coming up more often than members of my team are pushing – it seemed to discover a few changesets at a time, every 10 or so seconds, for the first few minutes I had the new version running. Even if this is fixed, though, I find it sufficient to have the number badge on the pull button, and don't want my attention called away from my work each time a teammate pushes.
Thanks!
fields.summary: disable popup notifications of changes to pull

fields.description:
From the blog (http://blog.sourcetreeapp.com/2013/05/07/sourcetree-for-mac-1-6/#comment-888864641):

"I can't get Araxis Merge to work with an actual 3-way merge. Launching an external diff works properly, but the "Resolve Conflicts->Launch External Merge Tool..." just quickly opens the external merge window and then closes it. I also see the <filename>.orig files building up in the folder.</filename>"

Author to provide more details.
fields.summary: Further help for wrong executables on assumed paths (Merge/Compare utilities)

fields.description:
I want a simple and obvious way to squash a set of merges on a ticket branch. I expected to be able to select all the commits in SourceForge, right-click and select Rebase. But Rebase is only enabled if a single commit is selected, and it's not at all clear to me what that is supposed to do.

Rebase Children of... is probably the thing I want, but it has issues:
 * It is not obvious which direction children are in, hence which commit to select.
 * The dialog that comes up is opaque
 * The manual contains no information about rebasing

I appreciate your effort to support interactive rebase in SourceForge but I think it needs a lot more work. For now I find the command-line interactive rebase much easier to understand than SourceTree.
fields.summary: Make rebase more flexible
